titlestmt.titleproper: Finding aid for the Huber family papers

profiledesc.creation: Encoded finding aid created from MARC record by Dallas Pillen
profiledesc.langusage: The finding aid is written in English

descgrp.accessrestrict: The collection is open for research use.

odd.head: General Note
odd.p: A Tangle of Asparagus: Letters and Landscapes of My Parents, by J. Parker Huber (2010) was written from these letters.

archdesc.bioghist: John Franklin Huber (Jack) was a graduate of the University of Michigan (M.D. 1929, Ph.D 1933), and chair of the Department of Anatomy at Temple University from 1944 to 1970. His wife, Gladys Stimpson Huber, was a native of Lynn, Massachusetts. They were married in 1933.
archdesc.scopecontent: Letters exchanged between Jack and Gladys before their marriage, 1932-1933, as well as scattered later letters; also letters to Jack's uncle John M. Parker, 1953-1954, and Jack's notebooks, 1913, 1935, 1937-1940, and miscellaneous other items. The collection is accompanied by notes about the contents written by Jack and Gladys's son J. Parker Huber.
